page.title: 01The Village of Halkirk
page.content: Halkirk is one of the larger villages in Caithness. Though it has many amenities for a village in this county, its proximity to the town of Thurso means that its residents generally commute for work & shopping. Despite this, farming does play a large part in the economic & social life of the village. The land is relatively fertile by the standards of the county. The village is built in a grid system & has grown up by the banks of the Thurso River, famous for its salmon. There is a community spirit in the village with many activities taking place there. East of the village is Georgemas Junction, the most Northerly railway junction in Britain, on the threatened Highland Line. At the height of the tourist season six trains a day pass through here on their way to & from Inverness.
